last_episode_to_air.name: Men on Leave
last_episode_to_air.overview: The soldiers are back on leave, which means Cecil, George and Bert finally have some other men to talk to.

name: Chickens
overview: It's the First World War. Our nation's heroes are fighting the good fight on foreign soil, but in one sleepy English village three young men remain: George is a conscientious objector, Cecil has flat feet and Bert really is a coward, unfortunately. They don't fight on the front line, but they do fight each other.

episodes.name: Bonfire Night
episodes.overview: George joins fianc√©e Winky in writing letters to lonely soldiers whilst Cecil joins the Needlework Guild to send them warm clothes and Bert fails to impress Agnes by trying to get in on the act since all the women are on sex strike in solidarity with the fighters at the front. Cecil however is dismayed to find that his is the effigy on the Guy Fawkes night bonfire.

episodes.name: Masculinity
episodes.overview: News arrives that the first Rittle man has died in battle, prompting Bert to make a move on his widow. George, meanwhile, faces a moral dilemma at work.

episodes.name: Brown Water
episodes.overview: The boys are immediately suspicious when, out of the blue, a pretty girl named Penny asks Cecil to be her boyfriend. Maybe, just maybe, she thinks Cecil is a catch. Or, she's got an ulterior motive.

episodes.name: Rebel Girl
episodes.overview: With so few men around, Cecil becomes paranoid that he is being systematically emasculated. Outraged, he decides to take matters into his own hands and prove his manhood once and for all.

episodes.name: Leper
episodes.overview: Cecil is horrified to learn that George has invited the village leper over for dinner, and he's even more horrified when the village leper stands them up.

episodes.name: Men on Leave
episodes.overview: The soldiers are back on leave, which means Cecil, George and Bert finally have some other men to talk to.
